AboutPage.metaTitle: About RxWatch | Canadian Drug Shortage Intelligence
AboutPage.metaDescription: Learn about RxWatch, a free tool for tracking Canadian drug shortages. Understand our data sources, update frequency, and how to use the service.
AboutPage.title: About RxWatch
AboutPage.subtitle: Free, real-time drug shortage intelligence for Canadians
AboutPage.disclaimerText: RxWatch is an informational tool only.
AboutPage.disclaimerConsult: Always consult your pharmacist, doctor, or other qualified healthcare professional before making any changes to your medications.
AboutPage.disclaimerAlternatives: Alternative medication suggestions require verification by a healthcare professional. Do not switch medications without professional guidance.
AboutPage.whatIsDesc1: RxWatch is a free, open-source tool that helps Canadians stay informed about drug shortages affecting medications they depend on. We aggregate data from official government sources and present it in an easy-to-understand format.
AboutPage.whatIsGoal: Our goal is to help patients, caregivers, and healthcare providers:
AboutPage.whatIsCheck: Check if a medication is currently in shortage
AboutPage.whatIsFind: Find potential therapeutic alternatives (for discussion with your doctor)
AboutPage.whatIsUnderstand: Understand which medications are being discontinued
AboutPage.whatIsNotAffiliated: RxWatch is not affiliated with Health Canada, Drug Shortages Canada, or any pharmaceutical company.
AboutPage.dataSourcesDesc: All data comes from official Canadian government and regulatory sources
AboutPage.dscDesc1: The mandatory reporting system for drug shortages and discontinuations in Canada. Pharmaceutical companies are legally required to report shortages to this database.
AboutPage.dscDesc2: Shortage reports, discontinuation notices, status updates, company information, shortage reasons, and estimated resolution dates.
AboutPage.dpdDesc1: The official database of all drugs authorized for sale in Canada. Contains detailed information about drug formulations, ingredients, and manufacturers.
AboutPage.dpdDesc2: Drug identification numbers (DINs), active ingredients, dosage forms, routes of administration, therapeutic classifications (ATC codes), and manufacturer information.
AboutPage.dataFreshnessDesc: How often we update our data
AboutPage.shortageReportsFreq: Updated every 15 minutes from Drug Shortages Canada API
AboutPage.drugCatalogFreq: Updated daily from Health Canada Drug Product Database
AboutPage.dataFreshnessNote: The last sync time is displayed in the header of every page. If you notice stale data, please let us know.
AboutPage.statusToBeDiscDesc: Drug will be permanently removed from market
AboutPage.statusDiscontinuedDesc: Drug has been permanently removed from market
AboutPage.statusResolvedDesc: Shortage has ended, drug is available again
AboutPage.tier3Desc: Tier 3 shortages are the most critical. These affect drugs where:
AboutPage.tier3Essential: The drug is essential for life-threatening conditions
AboutPage.tier3Harm: Interruption could cause serious harm to patients
AboutPage.alternativesDesc: When viewing a drug, we show two types of potential alternatives:
AboutPage.sameIngredientDesc: Other products containing the same active ingredient (different manufacturer, strength, or form)
AboutPage.sameClassDesc: Different drugs that may treat the same condition (same ATC classification)
AboutPage.alternativesWarning: These are suggestions only. Always consult your healthcare provider before switching to an alternative medication.
AboutPage.privacyDesc1: RxWatch does not collect personal health information. We do not require accounts or logins to use the service. Your searches are not tracked or stored.
AboutPage.privacyDesc2: We use basic analytics to understand how the service is used and improve it, but this data is anonymized and aggregated.
AboutPage.contactDesc: RxWatch is an open-source project. We welcome feedback, bug reports, and contributions.
AboutPage.finalDisclaimer1: RxWatch is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. While we strive for accuracy, we cannot guarantee the completeness or timeliness of the data.
AboutPage.finalDisclaimer2: For official information, always refer to

PrivacyPage.metaDescription: Privacy policy for RxWatch Canada, the Canadian drug shortage intelligence tool.
PrivacyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPage.overviewDesc: RxWatch Canada is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains what information we collect and how we use it.
PrivacyPage.collectNoPersonal: We do not collect personal information.
PrivacyPage.collectDesc: RxWatch does not require accounts, logins, or any form of registration. Your searches and browsing activity are not tracked or stored.
PrivacyPage.collectAnalytics: We collect only anonymous, aggregated analytics data to understand how the website is used and to improve performance. This includes:
PrivacyPage.collectPageViews: Page views and general traffic patterns
PrivacyPage.collectNote: This data cannot be used to identify individual users.
PrivacyPage.cookiesDesc: We use minimal, essential cookies for basic site functionality. We do not use tracking cookies or third-party advertising cookies.
PrivacyPage.thirdPartyDesc: We may use privacy-respecting analytics services to collect anonymous usage data. These services are configured to respect user privacy and do not track users across websites.
PrivacyPage.dataSourcesDesc: All drug shortage and product information displayed on RxWatch comes from official public sources: Drug Shortages Canada and Health Canada's Drug Product Database. We do not collect or store any personal health information.
PrivacyPage.changesDesc: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.
PrivacyPage.contactDesc: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at

TermsPage.metaDescription: Terms of service for RxWatch Canada, the Canadian drug shortage intelligence tool.
TermsPage.title: Terms of Service
TermsPage.disclaimerDesc: Always consult your pharmacist, doctor, or other qualified healthcare professional before making any changes to your medications.
TermsPage.acceptanceDesc: By using RxWatch Canada ("the Service"), you agree to these terms. If you do not agree, please do not use the Service.
TermsPage.descriptionDesc: RxWatch is a free informational tool that aggregates publicly available data about drug shortages and discontinuations in Canada. The Service displays information from Drug Shortages Canada and Health Canada's Drug Product Database.
TermsPage.noMedicalDesc1: The information provided by RxWatch is for informational purposes only and is not intended to be a substitute for professional medical advice, diagnosis, or treatment. Never disregard professional medical advice or delay seeking it because of information you read on this website.
TermsPage.noMedicalDesc2: Alternative medication suggestions shown on this website are provided for informational purposes only and must be verified by a qualified healthcare professional before making any changes to your medication regimen.
TermsPage.accuracyDesc1: While we strive to keep information accurate and up-to-date, we make no warranties about the completeness, reliability, or accuracy of the information displayed. Drug shortage information is sourced from official government databases and updated regularly, but may not reflect real-time availability at your local pharmacy.
TermsPage.accuracyDesc2: For official information, always refer to
TermsPage.liabilityDesc: RxWatch and its operators shall not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, or punitive damages arising from your use of the Service or any information obtained through it.
TermsPage.availabilityDesc: We do not guarantee that the Service will be available at all times. We may modify, suspend, or discontinue the Service at any time without notice.
TermsPage.ipDesc: RxWatch is open-source software. The source code is available on GitHub. Drug and shortage data is sourced from official Canadian government databases.
TermsPage.changesDesc: We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the Service after changes constitutes acceptance of the new terms.
TermsPage.contactDesc: If you have questions about these terms, please contact us at

Footer.disclaimer: This is not medical advice. Always consult your pharmacist or doctor.

ErrorPage.title: Something went wrong
ErrorPage.description: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.

NotFoundPage.title: Page Not Found
